posts.post_content:
I actually like this as being copies 5 - 8 of [Glimpse the Unthinkable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimpse the Unthinkable) rather than a straight reprint. It gives mill decks the ability to sit closer to burn in play style.  
  
4 Glimpse  
4 [Tome Scour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tome Scour)  
4 [Mind Sculpt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Sculpt)  
4 This  
4 [Surgical Extraction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surgical Extraction)  
4 [Thought Scour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thought Scour)  
4 [Mind Funeral](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Funeral)  
4 [Hedron Crab](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hedron Crab)  
4 [Jace's Phantasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace's Phantasm)  
2 [Wight of Precinct Six](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wight of Precinct Six)  
  
Mind Funeral is the only card here that costs more than two, you average 7ish milled a card. A deck has 53 cards to start, you will generally have milled an opponent by the time you've cast 8 cards. Not as fast as a burn deck, but a well placed Surgical Extraction can stumble an opponent enough to make the difference. Honestly, it'd be nice to have more cards like Breaking printed. If there were a reasonable replacement for Mind Funeral, aggro mill would probably see some play.
posts.html:
I actually like this as being copies 5 - 8 of Glimpse the Unthinkable rather than a straight reprint. It gives mill decks the ability to sit closer to burn in play style.

4 Glimpse
4 Tome Scour
4 Mind Sculpt
4 This
4 Surgical Extraction
4 Thought Scour
4 Mind Funeral
4 Hedron Crab
4 Jace's Phantasm
2 Wight of Precinct Six

Mind Funeral is the only card here that costs more than two, you average 7ish milled a card. A deck has 53 cards to start, you will generally have milled an opponent by the time you've cast 8 cards. Not as fast as a burn deck, but a well placed Surgical Extraction can stumble an opponent enough to make the difference. Honestly, it'd be nice to have more cards like Breaking printed. If there were a reasonable replacement for Mind Funeral, aggro mill would probably see some play.

posts.post_content: Am I the only person who's getting excited at the idea of using this fused to reanimate [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn)? I can't be, right? I mean, since it resolves as a single spell, you get to mill 8 cards and then reanimate IMMEDIATELY when you hit him, before the trigger even goes on the stack. With some library manipulation ([Long-Term Plans](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Long-Term Plans) at opponent's EOT anyone?) this effectively allows you to get Emrakul onto the battlefield for 8. I realise there are easier ways to do this, but the idea of reanimating Emrakul is just too exciting to me. And of course, the all-important haste that allows you to swing for 15 could easily be game-ending.
posts.html:
Am I the only person who's getting excited at the idea of using this fused to reanimate Emrakul, the Aeons Torn? I can't be, right? I realise there are easier ways to do this, but the idea of reanimating Emrakul is just too exciting to me. And of course, the all-important haste that allows you to swing for 15 could easily be game-ending.

Posted By: TheDouce (12/4/2013 9:59:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
FNM, Top 8: Me (Dimir Mill) vs Esper Control. Game 1 I milled him pretty fast. Game 2 started with an [Appetite for Brains](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Appetite for Brains) out of his sideboard, and I was like huh Breaking // Entering costs 8! After a fierce battle involving my [Augur of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Augur of Bolas) + [Psychic Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Psychic Strike) + [Pilfered Plans](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pilfered Plans) + [Tormad's Crypt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tormad's Crypt) vs his [Liliana of the Veil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana of the Veil) + [Lingering Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lingering Souls) + [Dissipate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dissipate), he resolved an [Obzedat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obzedat) and we were down to a race. In the end I managed to get him down to two cards before I died to Obzedat. I lost to his Lingering Souls + Snappy beatdown Game 3.  
  
Had the Entering half not been there I'd had won. Before next time I use this deck, I'm gonna cut every Breaking // Entering in half.
posts.html:
FNM, Top 8: Me (Dimir Mill) vs Esper Control. Game 1 I milled him pretty fast. Game 2 started with an Appetite for Brains out of his sideboard, and I was like huh Breaking // Entering costs 8! After a fierce battle involving my Augur of Bolas + Psychic Strike + Pilfered Plans + Tormad's Crypt vs his Liliana of the Veil + Lingering Souls + Dissipate, he resolved an Obzedat and we were down to a race. In the end I managed to get him down to two cards before I died to Obzedat. I lost to his Lingering Souls + Snappy beatdown Game 3.

Had the Entering half not been there I'd had won. Before next time I use this deck, I'm gonna cut every Breaking // Entering in half.

posts.post_content:
Correct me if I am wrong, but if you want to cast both at same time for 8 mana, you would need to pick a target creature in a yard before the mill 8 occurred, making it horrible synergy.  
  
Edit: Double checked the rules, entering does not say "target", and you resolve the left card first, then the right. So the mill 8 would occur first then you pick a creature, well done R&D
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Turn 1: Land  
Turn 2: Land, Breaking on yourself to potentially hit something huge (e.g. [Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griselbrand), [Sphinx of the Steel Wind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx of the Steel Wind))  
Turn 3: Land, [three](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=185054)-[mana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=185062) [cascade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=185056) spell into this, Entering  
  
I expect this to become a Modern reanimator staple. I've tried it out and it works wonders.
